Hippo CMS Walk-through

If you want to learn how to use the Hippo CMS, please refer to the comprehensive online documentation. This demo comes with Hippo CMS and a fully functional website Hippo Go Green. Here's the walk-through of some important features of Hippo CMS:

Hippo CMS

  • Logging into Hippo CMS
  • Editing and Creating Content
  • Managing Content via Workflow
  • Uploading Images & Assets

Go Green Website

  • Poll Component
  • Faceted Navigation

Logging into Hippo CMS  ↑


You can click on the Hippo CMS link on the left side to login to Hippo CMS. Hippo CMS comes with several user accounts by default. You can either use admin/admin or editor/editor or author/author as username/password combination. Each of these users have admin, editor and author roles respectively.

Editing and Creating Content  ↑


In Hippo CMS authors are responsible for creating the content. The CMS can be configured to create various types of documents. To create a new document, login to CMS as author (username: author, password: author).


Login as author

After you login you'll be presented with the dashboard view, just click on the Goto Documents button.


Dashboard - To Documents button

Search for a document by entering "dynamo" in the search box and press enter. The CMS will show the results in the document listing view. Click on the document name to view it in the editor. You can click on Edit to further edit the document.


Searching for a document

You can create a document by in any folder by clicking on the pop-up menu button. Just move your mouse pointer onto any folder name, and click on the pop-up button to open the menu. The menu will have several options depending on which folder you clicked on. To create a document just click on Add new document... menu item. You'll be presented with a wizard in which you can type in the document name and select the type of the document.


Folder Actions

The new document dialog shows available/configured document types you can create in this folder. To create a new News Article, make sure that you are in the news/YEAR/MONTH folder. This is necessary for the news article to appear at the appropriate location in the website.


Creating a new document

The document editor provides a way to edit the fields in a document. The document can also contain various meta data properties like tags, related documents, taxonomy etc. You can edit the document and add content to different fields. The Rich Text Editor area allows you to include internal links to another document or allows embedding of images in the content.


Document Editor

After you edit the document you can see the document in live/preview mode by clicking on the Show in preview environment in the website actions menu.


Previewing a document

Managing Content using Workflow  ↑


Once you are done with editing a document and satisfied with the way it looks in the preview, you can request for publication of the document. An editor can see your changes and approve or reject the request. After editing a document, click on the publication actions menu and select the Publish (request) ... action.This will send a request to editors and as an editor you can accept or reject this request for publication.


Requesting publication

Logout of CMS and login as editor(username/password: editor/editor). After you login you can see the new request in the ToDo list in the dashboard.


ToDo List - Request

When you click on the document, Hippo CMS automatically opens the corresponding document for viewing. You can click on the Requests menu to either accept or reject the request for publication.


Requests Menu for editor

Managing Images & Assets  ↑


You can upload images to the gallery and upload PDFs and other assets to the Assets. Just click on the corresponding sections in the documents accordion to bring up the Image folder listing or Asset folder listing. Moving your mouse on to any of the folder reveals the pop-up-button. Click on the pop-up button to create a new folder or upload a new image etc.


Uploading Images

Poll Component  ↑


Poll component lets your website users to vote on a poll created and managed using CMS. The poll component is added to the homepage of the Go Green site. You can edit or add a new poll using CMS, login to CMS and goto Hippo Go Green/Polls folder.


Poll Document in CMS


Poll on website

Faceted Navigation  ↑


Faceted Navigations allows to provide a better navigation for your website. Hippo CMS provides various ways to customize and create faceted navigation for your website. The Hippo Go Green website uses Faceted Navigation in several places. For example, the refine selection on Products page, uses faceted navigation, which dynamically filters the products based on your selection.

Hippo CMS has many other Great Features that help you rapidly build content driven websites. To find out more about Hippo CMS, read the on-line documentation or contact us via our onehippo.com website.
